text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Matikanefukukitaru, together with the<n>other Umamusume,
arrive at Tracen<n>Academy's seaside facilities for an<n>
intense summer training camp.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Phew... I didn't think I'd sweat this<n>much before even
beginning our<n>training!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Our main objective for this camp is<n>not leisure, but training.
Yet<n>Matikanefukukitaru has brought with<n>her a giant
suitcase filled with...<n>something.
choice_data_list: I hope that isn't filled with what I think it is.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I brought my lucky items with me! Or<n>well, most of them at
least. I left about<n>a hundred of them back in my dorm<n>
room. The rest are here with me!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I wanted to use this summer camp as<n>an opportunity to say
goodbye to all<n>my stuff. The question is, how do I go<n>about
doing it?
choice_data_list: How about just throwing it all out?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Throw it all out?! These are all my<n>precious lucky items!
Sure, I'm getting<n>rid of them, but I can't just throw<n>them
out like some common garbage!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Besides, littering is bad. We'd get in<n>trouble for tossing
trash onto the<n>beach. I'll admit that I brought all my<n>stuff
here without much of a plan in<n>mind.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
These lucky items have served me<n>well, so I'd like to give
them a proper<n>send-off—but how?

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Matikanefukukitaru went from<n>refusing to let go of her lucky
items to<n>sending them off on her own. It<n>appears she's
gone through a change<n>of heart.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
From where that change stems, I<n>don't know. But
regardless, it's<n>important that I take her feelings into<n>
consideration.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: You will?! I'd really appreciate the<n>help!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
The sound of chirping crickets and<n>crying cicadas fills the
hot summer air.<n>Then...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Oh, there you are! Be right there!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Matikanefukukitaru spots me and<n>briskly jogs over to my
side.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Why are you here? Where even are<n>we?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Hey, there's a little stream over<n>there! I didn't know this
area had a<n>river so close by. It really adds to the<n>
atmosphere.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
This is the perfect place to play with a<n>toy boat! Put it in the
water and see<n>what happens! If it stays afloat, great<n>
fortunes await us! And if it doesn't...<n>no big deal!
choice_data_list: We're getting rid of your stuff here.
We're getting rid of your stuff here.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Huh? Here? Ah, are you suggesting<n>we send off my lucky
items using this<n>river? I see...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Hm... a river memorial. It'd be a fitting<n>way to put my things
to rest—nice and<n>traditional.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
River spirits, river lanterns, river<n>ceremonies... Heck, we
even eat<n>noodles out of tiny rivers! One of<n>those is not like
the others, but<n>they've all got to do with rivers!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: I think it's a great idea!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I can reflect on every one of my lucky<n>items as I let them go
and hopefully<n>become a better me.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
And so begins Matikanefukukitaru's<n>lucky item river
send-off.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Farewell, kiddy lunch flag... I was able<n>to get good test
scores back in<n>elementary school thanks to you...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
You were my motivation to study hard<n>so Mom would take
me out and get a<n>kiddy meal...

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I suspect the real motivation was<n>nothing more than her
hungry<n>stomach, but I decide to remain silent<n>as I watch
her send off the flag down<n>the stream.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Next up is one of my most prized<n>lucky items—this crumpled
up playing<n>card.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Whenever I played using this card,<n>I'd always win! Its
iconic wrinkle<n>allowed me to seize victory by my<n>own
hands. Farewell, crumpled card!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I suppress the urge to make a remark<n>regarding her clearly
fraudulent antics,<n>and Matikanefukukitaru releases the<n>
card into the water.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
She repeats this process with the<n>remainder of her lucky
items until...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Finally, this is the last one! This<n>wooden doll was given to
me by my<n>grandma. It's one of my most<n>precious lucky
items.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I was always super shy and scared<n>of just about
everything. But my<n>grandma gave me this, telling me that<n>
she'd be watching over me no matter<n>where I am.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
But I'm all grown up now! I've finally<n>moved on! So please,
do the honors<n>by sending off my doll for me!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Grandma, I think I'll be fine on my<n>own now! Goodbye!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I'm sure Matikanefukukitaru's<n>grandmother is proudly
watching her<n>from the skies above.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I'll make sure to buy you a little<n>something before I head
back,<n>Grandma!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I retract my statement. I'm sure<n>she's proud from the
comfort of her<n>home.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Phew... Well, that's the last of it!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I feel like a new person! And to top it<n>all off, my room's
finally all clean!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Now all I need to do is take care not to<n>cause any more
trou— Wait a second...<n>Oh no!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I've already caused a huge problem!<n>This stream... It leads
to the ocean,<n>right?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: We just littered a bunch! Waaaah,<n>what do we do?!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
The flustered Matikanefukukitaru<n>panics, and we decide to
follow the<n>stream down to its mouth.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Oh? Who put this metal grate here? It<n>caught all my lucky
items...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Did you do this for me? You really are<n>prepared for
anything, aren't you?<n>It's like you can read my mind!
choice_data_list:
How about we send off your stuff with a small
bonfire instead?

How about we send off your stuff with a small
bonfire instead?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Sounds good! We can make a<n>beachside campfire and burn<n>
everything there!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Whoa... It's so pretty...

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
The pile of burning lucky items emits<n>a soft glow,
illuminating the now dark<n>beach.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I still have some of my lucky items<n>back in my dorm room,
but I'm still<n>surprised that I was able to part with<n>as much
as I did...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I don't think I can completely give up<n>my divinations or my
lucky items just<n>yet, but... I think I'm starting to get the<n>
importance of using your own power<n>to do things.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Besides, I'm sure the great Shiraoki<n>wouldn't approve of
me solely relying<n>on her.
choice_data_list:
The great Shiraoki would be proud to see you
now.

The great Shiraoki would be proud to see you
now.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Ehehe... It sounds embarrassing<n>when you put it like that...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I know I'll be just fine! After all, I<n>have the luckiest person
right by side.
choice_data_list: I'll do what I can to bring you good fortune.
I'll do what I can to bring you good fortune.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Oho! I hope you mean that. I'm going<n>to hold you to your
word. I expect lots<n>of good luck in the near future, got it?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: My arms are wide open! Give me all<n>the luck you've got!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I'm not sure which is burning<n>brighter—the blazing bonfire
we made<n>together, or the fiery spirit within<n>
Matikanefukukitaru's newly changed<n>heart.
